ai-tha-ap99:1.3_0: the best of sages is the best,
ai-tha-ap99:2.2_0: like a flame in the wind.
ai-tha-ap99:2.3_0: like the sun shining in the sick,
ai-tha-ap99:2.4_0: which is destroyed by gods and humans.
ai-tha-ap99:3.1_0: longing for honey, they’re the ones of first,
ai-tha-ap99:3.4_0: Having given it to the teacher,
ai-tha-ap99:4.1_0: I paid homage at the teacher’s feet,
ai-tha-ap99:4.2_0: went away from Pāvā to see her.
ai-tha-ap99:4.4_0: I was the king to see him.
ai-tha-ap99:5.1_0: like honey with their own hands.
ai-tha-ap99:5.4_0: and it is the fruit of the past.
ai-tha-ap99:6.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap99:6.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap99:6.4_0: this is the fruit for the honey.
ai-tha-ap99:7.1_0: It is allowable to go from here and there.
ai-tha-ap99:7.2_0: These are the four well-trained Buddhas,
ai-tha-ap99:9.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Macchikāsaṇḍa.
ai-tha-ap99:10.1_0: In the first of the Elder Macchikāsaṇḍa
